meanings.definition: A pair of embryonic excretory organs in some lower vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The pronephroi help remove waste in developing fish.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the pronephroi to understand early vertebrate development.
meanings.sent3: The fish joked that their pronephroi were like tiny vacuum cleaners.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature, the pronephroi are the tiny heroes fighting waste.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to show how pronephroi work in fish embryos.

meanings.definition: The anterior part of the embryonic kidney in vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: During development, the pronephroi form before the other kidney parts.
meanings.sent2: The pronephroi play a crucial role in early kidney function.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character proudly showed off his oversized pronephroi as a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the pronephroi working tirelessly inside her.
meanings.sent5: The book vividly described the intricate structure of the pronephroi in embryos.
